actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on September 13, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Auchincloss moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the victims of the recent shooting in Jacksonville, Florida.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the victims of the recent wildfires in Maui, Hawaii.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 413
actions-list.actionItem: 2 (Roll no. 385).

Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 492 — "Condemning the Government of Iran's state-sponsored persecution of the Baha'i minority and its continued violation of the International Covenants on Human Rights."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 410
actions-list.actionItem: 3 (Roll no. 384).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 589 — "To impose sanctions on the Supreme Leader of Iran and the President of Iran and their respective offices for human rights abuses and support for terrorism."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 403
actions-list.actionItem: 8 (Roll no. 383).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3152 — "To impose sanctions with respect to countries, individuals, and entities that engage in any effort to acquire, possess, develop, transport, transfer, or deploy Iranian missiles and related goods and technology, including materials and equipment, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 3152, as amended, and H.R. 589, as amended, and the motion to suspend the rules and agree to H. Res. 492, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3324.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3324 — "To extend the authority to collect Shasta-Trinity Marina fees through fiscal year 2029."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3389.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3389 — "To require the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service, and the Secretary of the Interior to conduct an evaluation with respect to the use of the container aerial firefighting system (CAFFS), and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Westerman objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1450.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1450 — "To amend the Agricultural Act of 2014 to modify the treatment of revenue from timber sale contracts and certain payments made by counties to the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior under good neighbor agreements, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1567.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1567 — "To require that the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior submit accurate reports regarding hazardous fuels reduction activities, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 492.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McCaul moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Res. 492 — "Condemning the Government of Iran's state-sponsored persecution of the Baha'i minority and its continued violation of the International Covenants on Human Rights."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 589.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McCaul moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 589 — "To impose sanctions on the Supreme Leader of Iran and the President of Iran and their respective offices for human rights abuses and support for terrorism."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3152.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McCaul moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3152 — "To impose sanctions with respect to countries, individuals, and entities that engage in any effort to acquire, possess, develop, transport, transfer, or deploy Iranian missiles and related goods and technology, including materials and equipment, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on September 11, 2023, at 4:18 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 294 and S. 2747.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Takano to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mariannette Miller-Meeks to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
